subject: Law
title: Trademark Strength Spectrum
description: A short lesson to help you apply Trademark Strength Spectrum.

hook.text: 'Apple' for computers is strong. 'Apple' for an apple farm is weak. The same word gets different protection.

buildup.text: Trademarks are ranked by distinctiveness: fanciful, arbitrary, suggestive, descriptive, and generic.

discovery.text: Fanciful marks (Xerox) are the strongest. Generic terms (escalator, aspirin) get zero protection.

twist.text: Brands can become generic through overuse. Thermos, aspirin, and escalator all lost their trademark status.

climax.text: Google actively fights 'googling' becoming generic. If it does, they could lose their trademark.

punchline.text: Too much success can kill a trademark. Popularity is a double-edged sword.

quiz.question: What happens when a trademark becomes generic?
